sections.title: Crash on startup
sections.content: Google Earth can crash on startup for numerous reasons. Here are some of the most common ones.

sections.title: Startup tips are enabled
sections.content:
While startup tips can be useful, they are also known to cause crashes. To disable them, change or add the line below to the ~/.config/Google/GoogleEarthPro.conf:

```
~/.config/Google/GoogleEarthPro.conf
```

```
[General]
enableTips=false
```

sections.title: No new line at the end of drirc
sections.content:
This can cause a crash with -dri drivers:

```
$ echo >> ~/.drirc
```

sections.title: Corrupt settings
sections.content:
In case the cache is corrupt and needs recreation, remove it:

```
$ rm -r ~/.googleearth/Cache/
```

If that did not work, try removing the whole settings directory:

```
$ rm -r ~/.googleearth/
```

sections.title: Another crash happened while handling crash!
sections.content:
You may try removing the following:

```
$ rm -f ~/.googleearth/Cache/cookies ~/.googleearth/instance-running-lock
```

sections.title: Wayland
sections.content:
Google Earth does not seem to support Wayland yet, forcing X11 helps in this situation. Launch using:

```
$ QT_QPA_PLATFORM=xcb google-earth-pro
```

sections.title: Panoramio photos not working
sections.content: There have been numerous reports [1] [2] [3] on this in the Google Earth forums with varying solutions.

sections.title: Graphical corruption
sections.content: Either refer to the #Corrupt settings section above or disable texture compression in Tools > Options... > 3D View > Compress.

sections.title: Earth shows nothing but yellow borders
sections.content:
Taken from the changelog of 7.0.3 this issue has improved to some extent but overall it is still there:

```
Imagery now displays for Linux users running specific families of Intel GPUs.
```

sections.title: Excessive memory use
sections.content: Memory use can be controlled by limiting the maximum cache size in Tools > Options... > Cache, or by lowering the graphics settings in the 3D View tab.
